Description:
Quality Lead – Fabrication & Offshore - Offshore Compression ProjectJob Scope:Implement the Project Quality Plan and ensure the effective implementation of Contractor’s Project Quality Management System and procedures at the Construction Site(s) to ensure that all project activities are compliant with project specifications, including:Implement the Construction Surveillance Program to confirm that all onshore construction activities are compliant with project specifications, including:Develop Fabrication Surveillance Plan and Installation Surveillance Plan for each fabrication and installation activity identifying key inspection interventions
Reviewing and approving Contractors and Subcontractors Inspection & Test Plans, quality control procedures and testing procedures
Implementing quality control over welding processes including monitoring of welding procedure qualifications, qualification of welders, control of welding consumables, surveillance of welding & NDE activity, monitoring welding KPIs and identifying corrective action to remedy poor performance
Attending regular construction meetings with Contractor and subcontractors to monitor progress and review and resolve quality issues arising.
Managing inspection resources using QG approved Site Inspection Service (SIS) agencies to conduct surveillance inspections at construction site(s) and offsite facilities such as spool shops 
Conducting Flawless Quality training programs and Welding training programs in conjunction with Contractor to eliminate common defects
Conducting regular site walk-throughs with construction site management team to highlight quality and safety issues and identify areas for improvement
Ensure that inspection records are maintained in a database that is aligned with completions management system to ensure a smooth handover to commissioning.Skills
Skills: Bachelor Degree or Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
CSWIP 3.2 Senior Welding Inspector or equivalent
Additional quality, welding or NDE inspection related qualifications
Minimum of 10 years broad experience in execution of major oil & gas projects, including at least 8 years involvement in the fabrication amd installation of subsea pipelines
Minimum of 8 years experience in a supervisory capacity of quality or inspection
Excellent written and verbal English language communication skills.
Ability to manage development and implementation of Quality Management Systems adapted to Oil & Gas industry.
Requires strong analytical, organisational and planning skills
